intro: Castilleja nubigena var. pumila, commonly known as the dwarf cloud castilleja, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has slender, hairy stems and is often found growing in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It forms symbiotic relationships with certain root fungi, which help it absorb nutrients from the soil. Its unique ecological role makes it an important species in its native ecosystem.
